member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters
member.summary: Parameters for teaching a Dnc finder.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.HeightSensitivity
member.summary: Minimum gradient magnitude to accept a local gradient as a feature in the depth images. The value specifies a threshold (in millimeters) above which local height changes are observed as characteristic features. A typical value is 1 mm. This value is also used implicitly during later search tasks. The minimum value is 0.0.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.DerivativePatchSize
member.summary: Smoothing area in pixels for gradient and normal calculation. The value controls the local environment in the depth images of the examples which is used to calculate gradients and normals.Minimum is 3. Larger values effectively result in a smoothing of the depth images. The value should be odd. Typical values are in the range 3..9. Smaller values should be favored, since the example images of the CAD object are flawless and free of noise.
member.remarks: The corresponding value of of a detection task should be equal, or - in case of sensor noise - bigger. The minimum value is 3.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.LocalDistributionSize
member.summary: Size of area in which local features are distributed (in pixels). To account for the finite and discrete example positions the local features are somewhat smeared out. This value specifies the local active range of a single feature. A typical value is 8. The minimum value is 0.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.NumGradientFeatures
member.summary: Number of gradient features retained in the classifier. To speed up the calculation of correspondences during a detection task, the possibly dense gradient features from the examples are thinned out to a minimum necessary number. This number strongly depends on the object itself. Typical values are between 100 and 1000. A value of 0 means that all gradient features should be used. The minimum value is 0.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.NumNormalFeatures
member.summary: Number of normal vector features retained in the classifier. To speed up the calculation of correspondences during a detection task, the dense normal features from the examples are thinned out to a minimum necessary number. This number strongly depends on the object itself. Typical values are between 100 and 1000. A value of 0 means that all normal features should be used. The minimum value is 0.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.ICPShrink
member.summary: ICP-subsample factor. To speed up search tasks, a voxel representation of the examples is pre-calculated. The subsample factor determins the amount of data used to perform an ICP-operation.It strongly influences the recognition speed and the amount of memory used. The recommended value is 4. The minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.DistanceKernelSize
member.summary: Factor for Distance transform calculation. A so called Huber kernel is used for the calculation of a distance transform of an example. To some extend a Huber kernel can possibly enlarge the convergence basin of ICP-operations, relative to the Euclidian distance transform (factor = 1). A recommended value is 2. The minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.TeachParameters.Default
member.summary: Default TeachParameters object.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters
member.summary: Definition of search parameters. Search parameters strongly influence the search results. Likewise, they have great influence on the timing of a search operation.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.HypothesesThreshold
member.summary: Minimum feature score for hypotheses generation. The value controls which areas of the depth image are used as candidates for closer examination. Typical values are in the range between 0.9 ... 1.0. The minimum value is 0.5.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.DerivativePatchSize
member.summary: Smoothing area in pixels for gradient and normal calculation. The value should be odd. Typical values are in the range 3..9. The minimum value is 3.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.IndifferentRadius
member.summary: Fraction of template size which accounts for a single object. The minimum value is 0.5.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.PartsToFind
member.summary: Maximum number of objects to find. A value of zero means that all objects should be found.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.RawResultsOnly
member.summary: If this flag is set, candidate locations are considered as hits without further investigation of these candidates. In this case, only parameters HypothesesThreshold, PartsToFind and MinScore are decisive for finding objects.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.ICPShrink
member.summary: Subsample factor for ICP. The minimum allowed value of 1 means no reduction(highest accuracy). With increasing reduction, the processing speed increases, but at the same time the accuracy of the results also decrease.Typical values are in a range 1..4. The minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.ICPMaxIterations
member.summary: The value specifies the maximum number of iterations of the ICP algorithm. Increasing the value may increase the accuracy of the result, while possibly increasing the processing time. A typical value is 10. The minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.PrecisionThreshold
member.summary: This value determines which deviation is considered tolerable, inconsistent or occlusion. The value depends on the quality of the point cloud data. A typical value is 2 mm, the minimum allowed value is 0.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.MinCoverage
member.summary: This value is a threshold (0..1) that specifies the minimum required coverage of the model view by the point cloud data in order for the hit to be counted. A typical value may be 0.8. It is influenced by PrecisionThreshold.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.MaxOcclusion
member.summary: This value is a threshold (0..1) that specifies the maximum allowed part of the model view which is occluded by the point cloud data in order for the hit to be counted. Occlusion is defined to be point cloud data lying between the model and the sensor. A typical value may be 0.2. It is influenced by PrecisionThreshold.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.MaxInconsistency
member.summary: This value is a threshold (0..1) that specifies the maximum allowed part of the model view to be inconsistent with the point cloud data in order for the hit to be counted. Inconsistency is defined to be point cloud data which is beyond the model. A typical value may be 0.2. It is influenced by PrecisionThreshold.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.MinScore
member.summary: This value is a threshold (0..1) that determines whether the candidate is counted as a hit. For this, a hash similarity score between final model view and point cloud data must exceed this limit. A typical value may be 0.8.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchParameters.Default
member.summary: Default search parameters.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchResult

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchResult.Theta
member.summary: Rotation angle of objects orientation.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Dnc.Search.SearchResult.Score
member.summary: Score Detection confidence value (0..1).
